channel.title: W3C Browser Testing and Tools Working Group-relevant MDN issues
channel.description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Browser Testing and Tools Working Group

item.title: [webdriver2] Issue with "WebDriver": Error in code provided
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/WebDriver

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?


There is an error in this code

Specific section or headline?

7th line
wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 10)

What did you expect to see?

from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.common.keys import Keys
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait
from selenium.webdriver.support.expected_conditions import presence_of_element_located



with webdriver.Firefox() as driver:
    wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 10)
    
    driver.get("http://google.com/ncr")
    driver.find_element_by_name("q").send_keys("cheese" + Keys.RETURN)

    wait.until(presence_of_element_located((By.CSS_SELECTOR, "h3>a")))

    results = driver.find_elements_by_css_selector("h3>a")
    for i, result in results.iteritems():
        print("#{}: {} ({})".format(i, result.text, result.get_property("href")))

Did you test this? If so, how?

I put the code in my IDE and say that driver was undefined in wait = WebDriverWait(driver, 10)

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/webdriver
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/WebDriver
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/webdriver/index.html
  • Last commit: d3ce09c
  • Document last modified: 2021-07-08T09:10:38.000Z

item.title: [webdriver2] Issue with "WebDriver": Broken/Missing links
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/WebDriver

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

2 broken links.

Specific section or headline?

In the "Usage" and "See also" sections.

What did you expect to see?

Links that took me to working or existing pages, and instead got errors for both.

Did you test this? If so, how?

Yes, by clicking the link in Usage that took me to this page which is broken, and the supposed Selenium docs which are now in this location instead.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/webdriver
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/WebDriver
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/webdriver/index.html
  • Last commit: 02dec84
  • Document last modified: 2021-04-30T06:42:17.000Z
